bit_field.name: TXPWDFS
bit_field.description: Note that this bit will be auto cleared if there is USB wakeup event while ENAUTOCLR_PHY_PWD bit of USBPHY_CTRL is enabled.

bit_field_value.name: PWD_TXPWDFS_PWR_DWN
bit_field_value.description: Power-down the USB full-speed drivers. This turns off the current starvation sources and puts the drivers into high-impedance output

bit_field.name: TXPWDIBIAS
bit_field.description: Note that this bit will be auto cleared if there is USB wakeup event while ENAUTOCLR_PHY_PWD bit of USBPHY_CTRL is enabled. Note that these circuits are shared with the battery charge circuit. Setting this bit to 1 does not power-down these circuits, unless the corresponding bit in the battery charger is also set for power-down.

bit_field_value.name: PWD_TXPWDIBIAS_PWR_DWN
bit_field_value.description: Power-down the USB PHY current bias block for the transmitter. This bit should be set only when the USB is in suspend mode. This effectively powers down the entire USB transmit path

bit_field.name: TXPWDV2I
bit_field.description: Note that this bit will be auto cleared if there is USB wakeup event while ENAUTOCLR_PHY_PWD bit of USBPHY_CTRL is enabled. Note that these circuits are shared with the battery charge circuit. Setting this to 1 does not power-down these circuits, unless the corresponding bit in the battery charger is also set for power-down.

bit_field_value.name: PWD_TXPWDV2I_PWR_DWN
bit_field_value.description: Power-down the USB PHY transmit V-to-I converter and the current mirror

bit_field.name: RXPWDENV
bit_field.description: Note that this bit will be auto cleared if there is USB wakeup event while ENAUTOCLR_PHY_PWD bit of USBPHY_CTRL is enabled.

bit_field_value.name: PWD_RXPWDENV_PWR_DWN
bit_field_value.description: Power-down the USB high-speed receiver envelope detector (squelch signal)

bit_field.name: RXPWD1PT1
bit_field.description: Note that this bit will be auto cleared if there is USB wakeup event while ENAUTOCLR_PHY_PWD bit of USBPHY_CTRL is enabled.

bit_field_value.name: PWD_RXPWD1PT1_PWR_DWN
bit_field_value.description: Power-down the USB full-speed differential receiver.

bit_field.name: RXPWDDIFF
bit_field.description: Note that this bit will be auto cleared if there is USB wakeup event while ENAUTOCLR_PHY_PWD bit of USBPHY_CTRL is enabled.

bit_field_value.name: PWD_RXPWDDIFF_PWR_DWN
bit_field_value.description: Power-down the USB high-speed differential receiver

bit_field.name: RXPWDRX
bit_field.description: This bit will be auto cleared if there is USB wakeup event while ENAUTOCLR_PHY_PWD bit of USBPHY_CTRL is enabled.

bit_field_value.name: PWD_RXPWDRX_PWR_DWN
bit_field_value.description: Power-down the entire USB PHY receiver block except for the full-speed differential receiver

bit_field.name: D_CAL
bit_field.description: Decode to trim the nominal 17.78mA current source for the High Speed TX drivers on USB_DP and USB_DM. This current is directly proportional to the amplitude of the High Speed TX eye diagram.

bit_field.name: TXCAL45DM
bit_field.description: Decode to trim the nominal 45ohm series termination resistance to the USB_DM output pin. Maximum resistance = 0000. Resistance is centered by design at 0110. Trimming this resistance will impact both the overshoot/undershoot of the Full Speed TX output and the amplitude of the High Speed TX output.

bit_field.name: TXCAL45DP
bit_field.description: Decode to trim the nominal 45ohm series termination resistance to the USB_DP output pin. Maximum resistance = 0000. Resistance is centered by design at 0110. Trimming this resistance will impact both the overshoot/undershoot of the Full Speed TX output and the amplitude of the High Speed TX output.

bit_field.name: USBPHY_TX_EDGECTRL
bit_field.description: Controls the edge-rate of the current sensing transistors used in HS transmit. NOT FOR CUSTOMER USE.

bit_field.name: ENVADJ
bit_field.description: The ENVADJ field adjusts the trip point for the envelope detector. Values shown below are nominal DC settings to indicate effect of changing these bits. AC values measured during compliance testing will be somewhat higher.

bit_field.name: DISCONADJ
bit_field.description: The DISCONADJ field adjusts the trip point for the disconnect detector.

bit_field.name: RXDBYPASS
bit_field.description: This test mode is intended for lab use only, replace FS differential receiver with DP single ended receiver.

bit_field_value.name: RX_RXDBYPASS_0b1
bit_field_value.description: Use the output of the USB_DP single-ended receiver in place of the full-speed differential receiver

bit_field.name: ENHOSTDISCONDETECT
bit_field.description: For host mode, enables high-speed disconnect detector. This signal allows the override of enabling the detection that is normally done in the UTMI controller. The UTMI controller enables this circuit whenever the host sends a start-of-frame packet. It shall be set after HS device is connected.

bit_field.name: HOSTDISCONDETECT_IRQ
bit_field.description: Indicates that the device has disconnected in High-Speed mode. Reset this bit by writing a 1 to the SCT clear address space and not by a general write.

bit_field.name: ENDEVPLUGINDET
bit_field.description: Enables non-standard resistive plugged-in detection

bit_field_value.name: CTRL_ENDEVPLUGINDET_0b0
bit_field_value.description: Disables 200kohm pullup resistors on USB_DP and USB_DM pins (Default)

bit_field_value.name: CTRL_ENDEVPLUGINDET_0b1
bit_field_value.description: Enables 200kohm pullup resistors on USB_DP and USB_DM pins

bit_field.name: DEVPLUGIN_IRQ
bit_field.description: Indicates that the device is connected. Reset this bit by writing a 1 to the SCT clear address space and not by a general write.

bit_field.name: ENUTMILEVEL2
bit_field.description: Enables UTMI+ Level 2 operation for the USB HS PHY. This should be enabled if an Embedded Host use case needs to support a LS device.

bit_field.name: ENUTMILEVEL3
bit_field.description: Enables UTMI+ Level 3 operation for the USB HS PHY. This should be enabled if an Embedded Host use case needs to support an external FS Hub with a LS device connected.

bit_field.name: AUTORESUME_EN
bit_field.description: Enable the auto resume feature, when set, HW will use 32KHz clock to send Resume to respond to the device remote wakeup(for host mode only). It's useful when PLL is off and reference clock is also powered down.

bit_field.name: ENAUTOCLR_CLKGATE
bit_field.description: Enables the feature to auto-clear the CLKGATE bit if there is wakeup event while USB is suspended. This should be enabled if needed to support auto wakeup without software interaction.

bit_field.name: ENAUTOCLR_PHY_PWD
bit_field.description: Enables the feature to auto-clear the PWD register bits in USBPHY_PWD if there is wakeup event while USB is suspended. This should be enabled if needed to support auto wakeup without software interaction.

bit_field.name: FSDLL_RST_EN
bit_field.description: Enables the feature to reset the FSDLL lock detection logic at the end of each TX packet.

bit_field.name: OTG_ID_VALUE
bit_field.description: Indicates the results of USB_ID pin while monitoring the cable plugged into the Micro- or Mini-AB receptacle. False (0) is when ID resistance is less than Ra_Plug_ID, indicating host (A) side. True (1) is when ID resistance is greater than Rb_Plug_ID, indicating device (B) side. Similar to the function of the OTGID_STATUS bit in the USBPHY_STATUS register, but OTG_ID_VALUE has debounce and system clock synchronization logic to filter the glitches on the USB_ID pad.

bit_field.name: HOST_FORCE_LS_SE0
bit_field.description: Forces the next FS packet that is transmitted to have a EOP with low-speed timing. This bit is used in host mode for the resume sequence. After the packet is transferred, this bit is cleared. The design can use this function to force the LS SE0 or use the USBPHY_CTRL_UTMI_SUSPENDM to trigger this event when leaving suspend. This bit is used in conjunction with USBPHY_DEBUG_HOST_RESUME_DEBUG.

bit_field.name: UTMI_SUSPENDM
bit_field.description: Used by the PHY to indicate a powered-down state. If all the power-down bits in the USBPHY_PWD are enabled, UTMI_SUSPENDM will be 0, otherwise 1 when USB controller entering into Suspend mode. UTMI_SUSPENDM is negative logic, as required by the UTMI specification.

bit_field.name: CLKGATE
bit_field.description: Gate UTMI Clocks. Clear to 0 to run clocks. Set to 1 to gate clocks. Set this to save power while the USB is not actively being used. Configuration state is kept while the clock is gated. Note this bit can be auto-cleared if there is any wakeup event when USB is suspended while ENAUTOCLR_CLKGATE bit of USBPHY_CTRL is enabled.

bit_field.name: SFTRST
bit_field.description: Writing a 1 to this bit will soft-reset the USBPHY_PWD, USBPHY_TX, USBPHY_RX, and USBPHY_CTRL registers. Set to 0 to release the PHY from reset.

bit_field.name: ENHOSTDISCONDETECT
bit_field.description: For host mode, enables high-speed disconnect detector. This signal allows the override of enabling the detection that is normally done in the UTMI controller. The UTMI controller enables this circuit whenever the host sends a start-of-frame packet. It shall be set after HS device is connected.

bit_field.name: HOSTDISCONDETECT_IRQ
bit_field.description: Indicates that the device has disconnected in High-Speed mode. Reset this bit by writing a 1 to the SCT clear address space and not by a general write.

bit_field_value.name: CTRL_SET_ENDEVPLUGINDET_0b1
bit_field_value.description: Enables 200kohm pullup resistors on USB_DP and USB_DM pins

bit_field.name: DEVPLUGIN_IRQ
bit_field.description: Indicates that the device is connected. Reset this bit by writing a 1 to the SCT clear address space and not by a general write.

bit_field.name: ENUTMILEVEL2
bit_field.description: Enables UTMI+ Level 2 operation for the USB HS PHY. This should be enabled if an Embedded Host use case needs to support a LS device.

bit_field.name: ENUTMILEVEL3
bit_field.description: Enables UTMI+ Level 3 operation for the USB HS PHY. This should be enabled if an Embedded Host use case needs to support an external FS Hub with a LS device connected.

bit_field.name: AUTORESUME_EN
bit_field.description: Enable the auto resume feature, when set, HW will use 32KHz clock to send Resume to respond to the device remote wakeup(for host mode only). It's useful when PLL is off and reference clock is also powered down.

bit_field.name: ENAUTOCLR_CLKGATE
bit_field.description: Enables the feature to auto-clear the CLKGATE bit if there is wakeup event while USB is suspended. This should be enabled if needed to support auto wakeup without software interaction.

bit_field.name: ENAUTOCLR_PHY_PWD
bit_field.description: Enables the feature to auto-clear the PWD register bits in USBPHY_PWD if there is wakeup event while USB is suspended. This should be enabled if needed to support auto wakeup without software interaction.

bit_field.name: FSDLL_RST_EN
bit_field.description: Enables the feature to reset the FSDLL lock detection logic at the end of each TX packet.

bit_field.name: OTG_ID_VALUE
bit_field.description: Indicates the results of USB_ID pin while monitoring the cable plugged into the Micro- or Mini-AB receptacle. False (0) is when ID resistance is less than Ra_Plug_ID, indicating host (A) side. True (1) is when ID resistance is greater than Rb_Plug_ID, indicating device (B) side. Similar to the function of the OTGID_STATUS bit in the USBPHY_STATUS register, but OTG_ID_VALUE has debounce and system clock synchronization logic to filter the glitches on the USB_ID pad.

bit_field.name: HOST_FORCE_LS_SE0
bit_field.description: Forces the next FS packet that is transmitted to have a EOP with low-speed timing. This bit is used in host mode for the resume sequence. After the packet is transferred, this bit is cleared. The design can use this function to force the LS SE0 or use the USBPHY_CTRL_UTMI_SUSPENDM to trigger this event when leaving suspend. This bit is used in conjunction with USBPHY_DEBUG_HOST_RESUME_DEBUG.

bit_field.name: UTMI_SUSPENDM
bit_field.description: Used by the PHY to indicate a powered-down state. If all the power-down bits in the USBPHY_PWD are enabled, UTMI_SUSPENDM will be 0, otherwise 1 when USB controller entering into Suspend mode. UTMI_SUSPENDM is negative logic, as required by the UTMI specification.

bit_field.name: CLKGATE
bit_field.description: Gate UTMI Clocks. Clear to 0 to run clocks. Set to 1 to gate clocks. Set this to save power while the USB is not actively being used. Configuration state is kept while the clock is gated. Note this bit can be auto-cleared if there is any wakeup event when USB is suspended while ENAUTOCLR_CLKGATE bit of USBPHY_CTRL is enabled.

bit_field.name: SFTRST
bit_field.description: Writing a 1 to this bit will soft-reset the USBPHY_PWD, USBPHY_TX, USBPHY_RX, and USBPHY_CTRL registers. Set to 0 to release the PHY from reset.

bit_field.name: ENHOSTDISCONDETECT
bit_field.description: For host mode, enables high-speed disconnect detector. This signal allows the override of enabling the detection that is normally done in the UTMI controller. The UTMI controller enables this circuit whenever the host sends a start-of-frame packet. It shall be set after HS device is connected.

bit_field.name: HOSTDISCONDETECT_IRQ
bit_field.description: Indicates that the device has disconnected in High-Speed mode. Reset this bit by writing a 1 to the SCT clear address space and not by a general write.

bit_field.name: ENDEVPLUGINDET
bit_field.description: Enables non-standard resistive plugged-in detection

bit_field_value.name: CTRL_TOG_ENDEVPLUGINDET_0b0
bit_field_value.description: Disables 200kohm pullup resistors on USB_DP and USB_DM pins (Default)

bit_field_value.name: CTRL_TOG_ENDEVPLUGINDET_0b1
bit_field_value.description: Enables 200kohm pullup resistors on USB_DP and USB_DM pins

bit_field.name: DEVPLUGIN_IRQ
bit_field.description: Indicates that the device is connected. Reset this bit by writing a 1 to the SCT clear address space and not by a general write.

bit_field.name: ENUTMILEVEL2
bit_field.description: Enables UTMI+ Level 2 operation for the USB HS PHY. This should be enabled if an Embedded Host use case needs to support a LS device.

bit_field.name: ENUTMILEVEL3
bit_field.description: Enables UTMI+ Level 3 operation for the USB HS PHY. This should be enabled if an Embedded Host use case needs to support an external FS Hub with a LS device connected.

bit_field.description: Enables the feature to auto-clear the PWD register bits in USBPHY_PWD if there is wakeup event while USB is suspended. This should be enabled if needed to support auto wakeup without software interaction.

bit_field.description: Enables the feature to reset the FSDLL lock detection logic at the end of each TX packet.

bit_field.name: CLKGATE
bit_field.description: Gate UTMI Clocks. Clear to 0 to run clocks. Set to 1 to gate clocks. Set this to save power while the USB is not actively being used. Configuration state is kept while the clock is gated. Note this bit can be auto-cleared if there is any wakeup event when USB is suspended while ENAUTOCLR_CLKGATE bit of USBPHY_CTRL is enabled.

bit_field.name: SFTRST
bit_field.description: Writing a 1 to this bit will soft-reset the USBPHY_PWD, USBPHY_TX, USBPHY_RX, and USBPHY_CTRL registers. Set to 0 to release the PHY from reset.

bit_field.name: HOSTDISCONDETECT_STATUS
bit_field.description: Indicates at the local host (downstream) port that the remote device has disconnected while in High-Speed mode.

bit_field_value.name: STATUS_HOSTDISCONDETECT_STATUS_0b0
bit_field_value.description: USB cable disconnect has not been detected at the local host

bit_field_value.name: STATUS_HOSTDISCONDETECT_STATUS_0b1
bit_field_value.description: USB cable disconnect has been detected at the local host

bit_field.name: DEVPLUGIN_STATUS
bit_field.description: Status indicator for non-standard resistive plugged-in detection

bit_field_value.name: STATUS_DEVPLUGIN_STATUS_0b0
bit_field_value.description: No attachment to a USB host is detected

bit_field_value.name: STATUS_DEVPLUGIN_STATUS_0b1
bit_field_value.description: Cable attachment to a USB host is detected

bit_field.name: OTGID_STATUS
bit_field.description: Indicates the results of USB_ID pin on the USB cable plugged into the local Micro- or Mini-AB receptacle. False (0) is when ID resistance to ground is less than Ra_Plug_ID, indicating host (A) side. True (1) is when ID resistance is greater than Rb_Plug_ID, indicating device (B) side.

bit_field.name: RESUME_STATUS
bit_field.description: Indicates that the host is sending a wake-up after Suspend and has triggered an interrupt.

bit_field.name: OTGIDPIOLOCK
bit_field.description: Once OTG ID from USBPHY_STATUS_OTGID_STATUS is sampled, use this to hold the value. This is to save power for the comparators that are used to determine the ID status.

bit_field.name: DEBUG_INTERFACE_HOLD
bit_field.description: Use holding registers to assist in timing for external UTMI interface.

bit_field.name: HSTPULLDOWN
bit_field.description: This bit field selects whether to connect pulldown resistors on the USB_DP/USB_DM pins if the corresponding pulldown overdrive mode is enabled through USBPHY_DEBUG[5:4} Set bit 3 to value 1'b1 to connect the 15ohm pulldown on USB_DP line. Set bit 2 to value 1'b1 to connect the 15ohm pulldown on the USB_DM line. Clear both bits to value 2'b00 to disconnect the pulldowns in override mode.

bit_field.name: ENHSTPULLDOWN
bit_field.description: This bit field selects host pulldown overdrive mode. Set bit 5 to value 1'b1 to override the control of the USB_DP 15kohm pulldown. Set bit 4 to value 1'b1 to override the control of the USB_DM 15ohm pulldown. Clear both bits to value 2'b00 to disable the host pulldown overdrive mode. When in host pulldown overdrive mode, the connection of the individual pulldown resistors is further controlled by the USBPHY_DEBUG[3:2] bit field.

bit_field.name: TX2RXCOUNT
bit_field.description: Delay in between the end of transmit to the beginning of receive. This is a Johnson count value and thus will count to 8.

bit_field.name: ENTX2RXCOUNT
bit_field.description: Set this bit to allow a countdown to transition in between TX and RX.

bit_field.name: SQUELCHRESETCOUNT
bit_field.description: Delay in between the detection of squelch to the reset of high-speed RX.

bit_field.name: ENSQUELCHRESET
bit_field.description: Set bit to allow squelch to reset high-speed receive.

bit_field.name: SQUELCHRESETLENGTH
bit_field.description: Duration of RESET in terms of the number of 480-MHz cycles.

bit_field.name: HOST_RESUME_DEBUG
bit_field.description: Choose to trigger the host resume SE0 with HOST_FORCE_LS_SE0 = 0 or UTMI_SUSPEND = 1.

bit_field.name: CLKGATE
bit_field.description: Gate Test Clocks. Clear to 0 for running clocks. Set to 1 to gate clocks. Set this to save power while the USB is not actively being used. Configuration state is kept while the clock is gated.

bit_field.name: OTGIDPIOLOCK
bit_field.description: Once OTG ID from USBPHY_STATUS_OTGID_STATUS is sampled, use this to hold the value. This is to save power for the comparators that are used to determine the ID status.

bit_field.name: LOOP_BACK_FAIL_COUNT
bit_field.description: Running count of the failed pseudo-random generator loopback. Each time entering testmode, counter goes to 900D and will count up for every detected packet failure in digital/analog loopback tests.

bit_field.name: UTMI_RXERROR_FAIL_COUNT
bit_field.description: Running count of the UTMI_RXERROR.

bit_field.name: SQUELCH_COUNT
bit_field.description: Running count of the squelch reset instead of normal end for HS RX.

bit_field.name: ENTAILADJVD
bit_field.description: Delay increment of the rise of squelch:

bit_field.name: ENTAILADJVD
bit_field.description: Delay increment of the rise of squelch:

bit_field.name: ENTAILADJVD
bit_field.description: Delay increment of the rise of squelch:

bit_field.name: ENTAILADJVD
bit_field.description: Delay increment of the rise of squelch:

bit_field.name: STEP
bit_field.description: Fixed read-only value reflecting the stepping of the RTL version.

bit_field.name: MINOR
bit_field.description: Fixed read-only value reflecting the MINOR field of the RTL version.

bit_field.name: MAJOR
bit_field.description: Fixed read-only value reflecting the MAJOR field of the RTL version.

bit_field.name: PLL_DIV_SEL
bit_field.description: This field controls the USB PLL feedback loop divider. The USB PLL is designed to produce a 480MHz output clock. This bit field allows use of different frequency signals for the PLL reference clock input connected to the OSCCLK signal from the system oscillator. When override is enabled through USBPHY_TRIM_OVERRIDE_EN[0], the USB PLL will use this register value.

bit_field.name: PLL_EN_USB_CLKS
bit_field.description: Enable the USB clock output from the USB PHY PLL.

bit_field.name: PLL_HOLD_RING_OFF
bit_field.description: Analog debug bit. Not for customer use. This bit field must remain at value 1'b0 for normal operation.

bit_field.name: PLL_POWER
bit_field.description: Power up the USB PLL.

bit_field.name: PLL_ENABLE
bit_field.description: Enable the clock output from the USB PLL.

bit_field.name: PLL_BYPASS
bit_field.description: Bypass the USB PLL.

bit_field.name: PLL_LOCK
bit_field.description: USB PLL lock status indicator

register.name: USB1_VBUS_DETECT
register.description: USB PHY VBUS Detect Control Register

bit_field.name: VBUSVALID_THRESH
bit_field.description: Sets the threshold for the VBUSVALID comparator. This comparator is the most accurate method to determine the presence of 5v, and includes hystersis to minimize the need for software debounce of the detection. This comparator has ~50mV of hystersis to prevent chattering at the comparator trip point.

bit_field.name: VBUS_OVERRIDE_EN
bit_field.description: VBUS detect signal override enable

bit_field_value.name: USB1_VBUS_DETECT_VBUS_OVERRIDE_EN_0b0
bit_field_value.description: Use the results of the internal VBUS_VALID and Session Valid comparators for VBUS_VALID, AVALID, BVALID, and SESSEND (Default)

bit_field_value.name: USB1_VBUS_DETECT_VBUS_OVERRIDE_EN_0b1
bit_field_value.description: Use the override values for VBUS_VALID, AVALID, BVALID, and SESSEND

bit_field.name: SESSEND_OVERRIDE
bit_field.description: Override value for SESSEND

bit_field.name: BVALID_OVERRIDE
bit_field.description: Override value for B-Device Session Valid

bit_field.name: AVALID_OVERRIDE
bit_field.description: Override value for A-Device Session Valid

bit_field.name: VBUSVALID_OVERRIDE
bit_field.description: Override value for VBUS_VALID signal sent to USB controller

bit_field.name: VBUSVALID_SEL
bit_field.description: Selects the source of the VBUS_VALID signal reported to the USB controller

bit_field_value.name: USB1_VBUS_DETECT_VBUSVALID_SEL_0b0
bit_field_value.description: Use the VBUS_VALID comparator results for signal reported to the USB controller (Default)

bit_field_value.name: USB1_VBUS_DETECT_VBUSVALID_SEL_0b1
bit_field_value.description: Use the VBUS_VALID_3V detector results for signal reported to the USB controller

bit_field.name: VBUS_SOURCE_SEL
bit_field.description: Selects the source of the VBUS_VALID signal reported to the USB controller

bit_field_value.name: USB1_VBUS_DETECT_VBUS_SOURCE_SEL_0b00
bit_field_value.description: Use the VBUS_VALID comparator results for signal reported to the USB controller (Default)

bit_field_value.name: USB1_VBUS_DETECT_VBUS_SOURCE_SEL_0b01
bit_field_value.description: Use the Session Valid comparator results for signal reported to the USB controller

bit_field_value.name: USB1_VBUS_DETECT_VBUS_SOURCE_SEL_0b10
bit_field_value.description: Use the Session Valid comparator results for signal reported to the USB controller

bit_field.name: VBUSVALID_TO_SESSVALID
bit_field.description: Selects the comparator used for VBUS_VALID

bit_field_value.name: USB1_VBUS_DETECT_VBUSVALID_TO_SESSVALID_0b0
bit_field_value.description: Use the VBUS_VALID comparator for VBUS_VALID results

bit_field_value.name: USB1_VBUS_DETECT_VBUSVALID_TO_SESSVALID_0b1
bit_field_value.description: Use the Session End comparator for VBUS_VALID results. The Session End threshold is >0.8V and <4.0V.

bit_field.name: PWRUP_CMPS
bit_field.description: Enables the VBUS_VALID comparator

bit_field.name: DISCHARGE_VBUS
bit_field.description: Controls VBUS discharge resistor

bit_field.name: EN_CHARGER_RESISTOR
bit_field.description: Enables resistors used for an older method of resistive battery charger detection

bit_field_value.name: USB1_VBUS_DETECT_EN_CHARGER_RESISTOR_0b0
bit_field_value.description: Disable resistive charger detection resistors on USB_DP and USB_DP

bit_field_value.name: USB1_VBUS_DETECT_EN_CHARGER_RESISTOR_0b1
bit_field_value.description: Enable resistive charger detection resistors on USB_DP and USB_DP

register.name: USB1_VBUS_DETECT_SET
register.description: USB PHY VBUS Detect Control Register

bit_field.name: VBUSVALID_THRESH
bit_field.description: Sets the threshold for the VBUSVALID comparator. This comparator is the most accurate method to determine the presence of 5v, and includes hystersis to minimize the need for software debounce of the detection. This comparator has ~50mV of hystersis to prevent chattering at the comparator trip point.

bit_field.name: VBUS_OVERRIDE_EN
bit_field.description: VBUS detect signal override enable

bit_field_value.name: USB1_VBUS_DETECT_SET_VBUS_OVERRIDE_EN_0b0
bit_field_value.description: Use the results of the internal VBUS_VALID and Session Valid comparators for VBUS_VALID, AVALID, BVALID, and SESSEND (Default)

bit_field_value.name: USB1_VBUS_DETECT_SET_VBUS_OVERRIDE_EN_0b1
bit_field_value.description: Use the override values for VBUS_VALID, AVALID, BVALID, and SESSEND

bit_field.name: SESSEND_OVERRIDE
bit_field.description: Override value for SESSEND

bit_field.name: BVALID_OVERRIDE
bit_field.description: Override value for B-Device Session Valid

bit_field.name: AVALID_OVERRIDE
bit_field.description: Override value for A-Device Session Valid

bit_field.name: VBUSVALID_OVERRIDE
bit_field.description: Override value for VBUS_VALID signal sent to USB controller

bit_field.name: VBUSVALID_SEL
bit_field.description: Selects the source of the VBUS_VALID signal reported to the USB controller

bit_field_value.name: USB1_VBUS_DETECT_SET_VBUSVALID_SEL_0b0
bit_field_value.description: Use the VBUS_VALID comparator results for signal reported to the USB controller (Default)

bit_field_value.name: USB1_VBUS_DETECT_SET_VBUSVALID_SEL_0b1
bit_field_value.description: Use the VBUS_VALID_3V detector results for signal reported to the USB controller

bit_field.name: VBUS_SOURCE_SEL
bit_field.description: Selects the source of the VBUS_VALID signal reported to the USB controller

bit_field_value.name: USB1_VBUS_DETECT_SET_VBUS_SOURCE_SEL_0b00
bit_field_value.description: Use the VBUS_VALID comparator results for signal reported to the USB controller (Default)

bit_field_value.name: USB1_VBUS_DETECT_SET_VBUS_SOURCE_SEL_0b01
bit_field_value.description: Use the Session Valid comparator results for signal reported to the USB controller

bit_field_value.name: USB1_VBUS_DETECT_SET_VBUS_SOURCE_SEL_0b10
bit_field_value.description: Use the Session Valid comparator results for signal reported to the USB controller

bit_field.name: VBUSVALID_TO_SESSVALID
bit_field.description: Selects the comparator used for VBUS_VALID

bit_field_value.name: USB1_VBUS_DETECT_SET_VBUSVALID_TO_SESSVALID_0b0
bit_field_value.description: Use the VBUS_VALID comparator for VBUS_VALID results

bit_field_value.name: USB1_VBUS_DETECT_SET_VBUSVALID_TO_SESSVALID_0b1
bit_field_value.description: Use the Session End comparator for VBUS_VALID results. The Session End threshold is >0.8V and <4.0V.

bit_field.name: PWRUP_CMPS

bit_field.description: Controls VBUS discharge resistor

bit_field.name: EN_CHARGER_RESISTOR
bit_field.description: Enables resistors used for an older method of resistive battery charger detection

bit_field_value.name: USB1_VBUS_DETECT_SET_EN_CHARGER_RESISTOR_0b0
bit_field_value.description: Disable resistive charger detection resistors on USB_DP and USB_DP

bit_field_value.name: USB1_VBUS_DETECT_SET_EN_CHARGER_RESISTOR_0b1

register.name: USB1_VBUS_DET_STAT
register.description: USB PHY VBUS Detector Status Register

bit_field.name: SESSEND
bit_field.description: Session End indicator

bit_field_value.name: USB1_VBUS_DET_STAT_SESSEND_0b0
bit_field_value.description: The VBUS voltage is above the Session Valid threshold

bit_field_value.name: USB1_VBUS_DET_STAT_SESSEND_0b1
bit_field_value.description: The VBUS voltage is below the Session Valid threshold

bit_field.name: BVALID
bit_field.description: B-Device Session Valid status

bit_field_value.name: USB1_VBUS_DET_STAT_BVALID_0b0
bit_field_value.description: The VBUS voltage is below the Session Valid threshold

bit_field_value.name: USB1_VBUS_DET_STAT_BVALID_0b1
bit_field_value.description: The VBUS voltage is above the Session Valid threshold

bit_field.name: AVALID
bit_field.description: A-Device Session Valid status

bit_field_value.name: USB1_VBUS_DET_STAT_AVALID_0b0
bit_field_value.description: The VBUS voltage is below the Session Valid threshold

bit_field_value.name: USB1_VBUS_DET_STAT_AVALID_0b1
bit_field_value.description: The VBUS voltage is above the Session Valid threshold

bit_field.name: VBUS_VALID
bit_field.description: VBUS voltage status

bit_field_value.name: USB1_VBUS_DET_STAT_VBUS_VALID_0b0
bit_field_value.description: VBUS is below the comparator threshold

bit_field_value.name: USB1_VBUS_DET_STAT_VBUS_VALID_0b1
bit_field_value.description: VBUS is above the comparator threshold

bit_field.name: VBUS_VALID_3V
bit_field.description: VBUS_VALID_3V detector status

bit_field_value.name: USB1_VBUS_DET_STAT_VBUS_VALID_3V_0b0
bit_field_value.description: VBUS voltage is below VBUS_VALID_3V threshold

bit_field_value.name: USB1_VBUS_DET_STAT_VBUS_VALID_3V_0b1
bit_field_value.description: VBUS voltage is above VBUS_VALID_3V threshold

register.name: USB1_CHRG_DET_STAT
register.description: USB PHY Charger Detect Status Register

bit_field.name: PLUG_CONTACT
bit_field.description: Battery Charging Data Contact Detection phase output

bit_field_value.name: USB1_CHRG_DET_STAT_PLUG_CONTACT_0b0
bit_field_value.description: No USB cable attachment has been detected

bit_field_value.name: USB1_CHRG_DET_STAT_PLUG_CONTACT_0b1
bit_field_value.description: A USB cable attachment between the device and host has been detected

bit_field.name: CHRG_DETECTED
bit_field.description: Battery Charging Primary Detection phase output

bit_field_value.name: USB1_CHRG_DET_STAT_CHRG_DETECTED_0b0
bit_field_value.description: Standard Downstream Port (SDP) has been detected

bit_field.name: DM_STATE
bit_field.description: Single ended receiver output for the USB_DM pin, from charger detection circuits.

bit_field.name: DP_STATE
bit_field.description: Single ended receiver output for the USB_DP pin, from charger detection circuits.

bit_field.name: SECDET_DCP
bit_field.description: Battery Charging Secondary Detection phase output

bit_field_value.name: USB1_CHRG_DET_STAT_SECDET_DCP_0b0
bit_field_value.description: Charging Downstream Port (CDP) has been detected

bit_field_value.name: USB1_CHRG_DET_STAT_SECDET_DCP_0b1
bit_field_value.description: Downstream Charging Port (DCP) has been detected

bit_field.name: TESTCLK_SEL
bit_field.description: Test clock selection to analog test. Not for customer use. The value of this bit field must remain at 1'b0 for normal operation.

bit_field.name: PFD_CLKGATE
bit_field.description: This bit field controls clock gating (disabling) for the PFD pfd_clk output for power savings when the PFD is not used. Setting the bit to value 1'b1 will gate the output of PFD. This gating will also be enabled if the PFD reference clock is not stable, the USB PLL is not locked, or the USB PLL is not enabled.This bit field must be reset to value 1'b0 to enable the pfd_clk output.

bit_field.name: PFD_CLK_SEL
bit_field.description: This bit field for the PFD selects the frequency relationship between the local pfd_clk output and the exported USB1PFDCLK.

bit_field_value.name: ANACTRL_PFD_CLK_SEL_XTAL
bit_field_value.description: USB1PFDCLK is the same frequency as the xtal clock (Default)

bit_field_value.name: ANACTRL_PFD_CLK_SEL_DIV4
bit_field_value.description: USB1PFDCLK frequency is pfd_clk divided by 4

bit_field_value.name: ANACTRL_PFD_CLK_SEL_DIV2
bit_field_value.description: USB1PFDCLK frequency is pfd_clk divided by 2

bit_field_value.name: ANACTRL_PFD_CLK_SEL_PFD_CLK
bit_field_value.description: USB1PFDCLK frequency is the same as pfd_clk frequency

bit_field.name: PFD_FRAC
bit_field.description: PFD fractional divider setting used to select the pfd_clk output frequency. Changing this bit field will cause pfd_update to be toggled. The pfd_clk output frequency is 480MHz*18/N where N=18~35. Valid values of PFD_FRAC are from 6'd18 to 6'd35, other values may cause undefined results.

bit_field.name: DEV_PULLDOWN
bit_field.description: Setting this field to 1'b1 will enable the 15kohm pulldown resistors on both USB_DP and USB_DM pins. This feature can be used in device mode while the USB cable is disconnected to keep the data pins at known values, avoiding unnecessary interrupts from the single ended receivers. This bit must be reset to 1'b0 during normal USB data communication in device mode, or while battery charger detection using the USBHSDCD module is used.

bit_field_value.name: ANACTRL_DEV_PULLDOWN_0b0
bit_field_value.description: The 15kohm nominal pulldowns on the USB_DP and USB_DM pinsare disabled in device mode.

bit_field_value.name: ANACTRL_DEV_PULLDOWN_0b1
bit_field_value.description: The 15kohm nominal pulldowns on the USB_DP and USB_DM pinsare enabled in device mode.

bit_field.name: EMPH_PULSE_CTRL
bit_field.description: Controls pre-emphasis time duration for the High Speed TX drivers after each data transition when the USBPHY_ANACTRL[EMPH_EN] bit is set high to 1'b1.The time duration for the pre-emphasis current increases as the value written to this bit field increases.

bit_field_value.name: ANACTRL_EMPH_PULSE_CTRL_0b00
bit_field_value.description: Minimum duration of pre-emphasis current after each data transition

bit_field_value.name: ANACTRL_EMPH_PULSE_CTRL_0b11
bit_field_value.description: Maximum duration of pre-emphasis current after each data transition

bit_field.name: EMPH_EN
bit_field.description: Enables pre-emphasis for the High-Speed TX drivers. Pre-emphasis adds additional output drive current for a brief period after each data transition. Use of pre-emphasis may be useful to optimize signal integrity depending on board design choices.

bit_field_value.name: ANACTRL_EMPH_EN_0b0
bit_field_value.description: No pre-emphasis is used on HS TX output drivers

bit_field_value.name: ANACTRL_EMPH_EN_0b1
bit_field_value.description: Enables pre-emphasis for HS TX output drivers

bit_field.name: EMPH_CUR_CTRL
bit_field.description: Controls the amount of pre-emphasis current added for the High-Speed TX drivers after each data transition when the USBPHY_ANACTRL[EMPH_EN] bit is set high to 1'b1. Each unit of pre-emphasis current adds approximately 3% to the nominal HS TX output current.

bit_field_value.name: ANACTRL_EMPH_CUR_CTRL_0b00
bit_field_value.description: No pre-emphasis current is enabled for the HS TX drivers

bit_field_value.name: ANACTRL_EMPH_CUR_CTRL_0b01
bit_field_value.description: One unit of pre-emphasis current is enabled for the HS TX drivers

bit_field_value.name: ANACTRL_EMPH_CUR_CTRL_0b10
bit_field_value.description: Two units of pre-emphasis current are enabled for the HS TX drivers

bit_field_value.name: ANACTRL_EMPH_CUR_CTRL_0b11
bit_field_value.description: Three units of pre-emphasis current are enabled for the HS TX drivers

bit_field.name: PFD_STABLE
bit_field.description: PFD stable signal from the Phase Fractional Divider.

bit_field.name: TESTCLK_SEL
bit_field.description: Test clock selection to analog test. Not for customer use. The value of this bit field must remain at 1'b0 for normal operation.

bit_field.name: EMPH_PULSE_CTRL
bit_field.description: Controls pre-emphasis time duration for the High Speed TX drivers after each data transition when the USBPHY_ANACTRL[EMPH_EN] bit is set high to 1'b1.The time duration for the pre-emphasis current increases as the value written to this bit field increases.

bit_field_value.name: ANACTRL_CLR_EMPH_PULSE_CTRL_0b00
bit_field_value.description: Minimum duration of pre-emphasis current after each data transition

bit_field_value.name: ANACTRL_CLR_EMPH_PULSE_CTRL_0b11
bit_field_value.description: Maximum duration of pre-emphasis current after each data transition

bit_field.name: EMPH_EN
bit_field.description: Enables pre-emphasis for the High-Speed TX drivers. Pre-emphasis adds additional output drive current for a brief period after each data transition. Use of pre-emphasis may be useful to optimize signal integrity depending on board design choices.

bit_field_value.name: ANACTRL_CLR_EMPH_EN_0b0
bit_field_value.description: No pre-emphasis is used on HS TX output drivers

bit_field_value.name: ANACTRL_CLR_EMPH_EN_0b1
bit_field_value.description: Enables pre-emphasis for HS TX output drivers

bit_field.name: EMPH_CUR_CTRL
bit_field.description: Controls the amount of pre-emphasis current added for the High-Speed TX drivers after each data transition when the USBPHY_ANACTRL[EMPH_EN] bit is set high to 1'b1. Each unit of pre-emphasis current adds approximately 3% to the nominal HS TX output current.

bit_field_value.name: ANACTRL_CLR_EMPH_CUR_CTRL_0b00
bit_field_value.description: No pre-emphasis current is enabled for the HS TX drivers

bit_field_value.name: ANACTRL_CLR_EMPH_CUR_CTRL_0b01
bit_field_value.description: One unit of pre-emphasis current is enabled for the HS TX drivers

bit_field_value.name: ANACTRL_CLR_EMPH_CUR_CTRL_0b10
bit_field_value.description: Two units of pre-emphasis current are enabled for the HS TX drivers

bit_field_value.name: ANACTRL_CLR_EMPH_CUR_CTRL_0b11
bit_field_value.description: Three units of pre-emphasis current are enabled for the HS TX drivers

bit_field.name: PFD_STABLE
bit_field.description: PFD stable signal from the Phase Fractional Divider.

bit_field.name: TESTCLK_SEL
bit_field.description: Test clock selection to analog test. Not for customer use. The value of this bit field must remain at 1'b0 for normal operation.

bit_field.name: PFD_CLKGATE
bit_field.description: This bit field controls clock gating (disabling) for the PFD pfd_clk output for power savings when the PFD is not used. Setting the bit to value 1'b1 will gate the output of PFD. This gating will also be enabled if the PFD reference clock is not stable, the USB PLL is not locked, or the USB PLL is not enabled.This bit field must be reset to value 1'b0 to enable the pfd_clk output.

bit_field.name: PFD_CLK_SEL
bit_field.description: This bit field for the PFD selects the frequency relationship between the local pfd_clk output and the exported USB1PFDCLK.

bit_field_value.name: ANACTRL_TOG_PFD_CLK_SEL_0b00
bit_field_value.description: USB1PFDCLK is the same frequency as the xtal clock (Default)

bit_field_value.name: ANACTRL_TOG_PFD_CLK_SEL_0b01
bit_field_value.description: USB1PFDCLK frequency is pfd_clk divided by 4

bit_field_value.name: ANACTRL_TOG_PFD_CLK_SEL_0b10
bit_field_value.description: USB1PFDCLK frequency is pfd_clk divided by 2

bit_field_value.name: ANACTRL_TOG_PFD_CLK_SEL_0b11
bit_field_value.description: USB1PFDCLK frequency is the same as pfd_clk frequency

bit_field.name: PFD_FRAC
bit_field.description: PFD fractional divider setting used to select the pfd_clk output frequency. Changing this bit field will cause pfd_update to be toggled. The pfd_clk output frequency is 480MHz*18/N where N=18~35. Valid values of PFD_FRAC are from 6'd18 to 6'd35, other values may cause undefined results.

bit_field.name: DEV_PULLDOWN
bit_field.description: Setting this field to 1'b1 will enable the 15kohm pulldown resistors on both USB_DP and USB_DM pins. This feature can be used in device mode while the USB cable is disconnected to keep the data pins at known values, avoiding unnecessary interrupts from the single ended receivers. This bit must be reset to 1'b0 during normal USB data communication in device mode, or while battery charger detection using the USBHSDCD module is used.

bit_field_value.name: ANACTRL_TOG_DEV_PULLDOWN_0b0
bit_field_value.description: The 15kohm nominal pulldowns on the USB_DP and USB_DM pinsare disabled in device mode.

bit_field_value.name: ANACTRL_TOG_DEV_PULLDOWN_0b1
bit_field_value.description: The 15kohm nominal pulldowns on the USB_DP and USB_DM pinsare enabled in device mode.

bit_field.name: EMPH_PULSE_CTRL
bit_field.description: Controls pre-emphasis time duration for the High Speed TX drivers after each data transition when the USBPHY_ANACTRL[EMPH_EN] bit is set high to 1'b1.The time duration for the pre-emphasis current increases as the value written to this bit field increases.

bit_field_value.name: ANACTRL_TOG_EMPH_PULSE_CTRL_0b00
bit_field_value.description: Minimum duration of pre-emphasis current after each data transition

bit_field_value.name: ANACTRL_TOG_EMPH_PULSE_CTRL_0b11
bit_field_value.description: Maximum duration of pre-emphasis current after each data transition

bit_field.name: EMPH_EN
bit_field.description: Enables pre-emphasis for the High-Speed TX drivers. Pre-emphasis adds additional output drive current for a brief period after each data transition. Use of pre-emphasis may be useful to optimize signal integrity depending on board design choices.

bit_field_value.name: ANACTRL_TOG_EMPH_EN_0b0
bit_field_value.description: No pre-emphasis is used on HS TX output drivers

bit_field_value.name: ANACTRL_TOG_EMPH_EN_0b1
bit_field_value.description: Enables pre-emphasis for HS TX output drivers

bit_field.name: EMPH_CUR_CTRL
bit_field.description: Controls the amount of pre-emphasis current added for the High-Speed TX drivers after each data transition when the USBPHY_ANACTRL[EMPH_EN] bit is set high to 1'b1. Each unit of pre-emphasis current adds approximately 3% to the nominal HS TX output current.

bit_field_value.name: ANACTRL_TOG_EMPH_CUR_CTRL_0b00
bit_field_value.description: No pre-emphasis current is enabled for the HS TX drivers

bit_field_value.name: ANACTRL_TOG_EMPH_CUR_CTRL_0b01
bit_field_value.description: One unit of pre-emphasis current is enabled for the HS TX drivers

bit_field_value.name: ANACTRL_TOG_EMPH_CUR_CTRL_0b10
bit_field_value.description: Two units of pre-emphasis current are enabled for the HS TX drivers

bit_field_value.name: ANACTRL_TOG_EMPH_CUR_CTRL_0b11
bit_field_value.description: Three units of pre-emphasis current are enabled for the HS TX drivers

bit_field.name: PFD_STABLE
bit_field.description: PFD stable signal from the Phase Fractional Divider.

bit_field.name: UTMI_TESTSTART
bit_field.description: This bit enables the USB loopback test.

bit_field.name: UTMI_DIG_TST0
bit_field.description: Mode control for USB loopback test. Setting this bit to a value of 1'b1 while UTMI_DIG_TST1 remains at a value of 1'b0 selects Pulse mode for the loopback test.

bit_field.name: UTMI_DIG_TST1
bit_field.description: Mode control for USB loopback test. Setting this bit to a value of 1'b1 while UTMI_DIG_TST0 remains at a value of 1'b0 selects Psuedorandom modes for the loopback test.

bit_field.name: TSTI_TX_HS_MODE
bit_field.description: Select HS or FS mode for USB loopback testing. Set to value 1'b1 to choose HS for USB loopback testing, set to value 1'b0 to choose FS mode.

bit_field.name: TSTI_TX_LS_MODE
bit_field.description: Set to value 1'b1 to choose LS for USB loopback testing, set to value 1'b0 to choose HS or FS mode which is defined by TSTI1_TX_HS.

bit_field.name: TSTI_TX_EN
bit_field.description: Enable TX for USB loopback test.

bit_field.name: TSTI_TX_HIZ
bit_field.description: Sets TX Hi-Z for USB loopback test.

bit_field.name: UTMO_DIG_TST0
bit_field.description: This read-only bit is a status bit for USB loopback test results. Value = 1'b0 indicates a passing result. Test results are only valid while UTMI_TESTSTART is set to value 1'b1.

bit_field.name: UTMO_DIG_TST1
bit_field.description: This read-only bit is a status bit for USB loopback test. Value = 1'b1 indicates a passing result. Test results are only valid while UTMI_TESTSTART is set to value 1'b1.

bit_field.name: TSTI_HSFS_MODE_EN
bit_field.description: Setting this bit field to value 1'b1 will enable the loopback test to dynamically change the packet speed. It will send a number of High Speed packets determined by USBPHY_USB1_LOOPBACK_HSFSCNT[TSTI_HS_NUMBER], followed by a number of Full Speed packets determined by USBPHY_USB1_LOOPBACK_HSFSCNT[TSTI_FS_NUMBER].

bit_field.name: TSTPKT
bit_field.description: Selects the packet data byte used for USB loopback testing in Pulse mode. Pulse mode is selected by setting USBPHY_USB1_LOOPBACK[2:1] to a value of 2'b01. Default value produces a data inversion at each unit interval.

bit_field.description: Select HS or FS mode for USB loopback testing. Set to value 1'b1 to choose HS for USB loopback testing, set to value 1'b0 to choose FS mode.

bit_field.name: TSTI_TX_LS_MODE
bit_field.description: Set to value 1'b1 to choose LS for USB loopback testing, set to value 1'b0 to choose HS or FS mode which is defined by TSTI1_TX_HS.

bit_field.name: TSTI_FS_NUMBER
bit_field.description: Full speed packet number, used when USBPHY_USB1_LOOPBACK[TSTI_HSFS_MODE_EN] is set to value 1'b1.

bit_field.description: Override enable for PLL_DIV_SEL, when set, the register value in USBPHY_PLL_SIC[1:0] will be used.
